quest.name: Amalj'aa Wrong Places
journal: Isembard seems to have a message for you from Thancred.
Thancred has been searching for you, and bids you meet him near the Amalj'aa encampment to the southeast of Camp Drybone.
You meet Thancred outside the nearby Amalj'aa encampment. He asks that you enter and search for evidence of their involvement in the vanishings at Camp Drybone.
You have found a suspicious leaflet. Return to Thancred and show it to him.
The leaflet does not appear to have been written by a member of the Order. Show it to Sister Ourcen at the inn at Camp Drybone to see if she can provide any insight.

Sister Ourcen confirms that the leaflet is not of the Order's making, and goes on to tell you that the church was recently plagued by a rash of missing garments. Speak with Thancred to determine your next course of action.
Thancred believes it likely that the culprit behind the vanishings is posing as a priest of the Order. Warn Isembard of this potential danger.

Isembard resolves to stay vigilant in light of the new information. Thancred, meanwhile, has withdrawn to consider the situation more carefully. What course of action might the Sharlayan bard come up with?
objectives: Search for a clue in the Amalj'aa encampment.
Show the queer leaflet to Thancred.
Show the queer leaflet to Sister Ourcen.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: I am well glad I reserved that inn room for Sister Ourcen. It seems she received greater injuries from her attackers than she initially let on. Thankfully, she is expected to make a full recovery.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: But now, on to the matter at hand. Thancred came looking for you once more. He left word that he will be waiting at the Amalj'aa encampment to the southeast. I pray the two of you are able to uncover some evidence regarding these disappearances.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Ah, there you are, Forename. So good of you to come!

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Indeed, I've heard all about good Sister Ourcen. Isembard said her wounds were serious. It would seem my suspicions about the poor rose were misplaced.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But false though they were, perhaps my suspicions were not entirely without merit. Whilst following Sister Ourcen near the Golden Bazaar, a band of Amalj'aa caught my eye.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I tracked them as far as this encampment, but... Well, let us say that I would much prefer to keep my distance and remain here. This, of course, brings me to why I requested you, dear Forename. Would you be so kind as to take a look inside?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: I'd much prefer to keep an eye on things from out here. Go and take a look about inside, would you?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Well? Did anything tickle your fancy?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: This leaflet... “See the wealth of Nald to the hands of your children.” It looks to be some sort of assembly to provide the poor with work.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The lettering, though... Atrocious, is it not? And these bits about Nald'thal seem somewhat...less than studied. I find it hard to believe one among the Order penned this.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Pray take this to the inn at Camp Drybone. Let us see what Sister Ourcen makes of it.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: Now, let us see what Sister Ourcen makes of this leaflet.

dialogue.name: OURCEN
dialogue.text: My savior comes again. To what do I owe the honor this day?

dialogue.name: OURCEN
dialogue.text: What is this? Blasphemous... These are not our teachings at all! This was not made by any true brother or sister of the Order─of that, I can assure you.

dialogue.name: OURCEN
dialogue.text: Come to think of it, weeks ago, the church was plagued by missing garments. Could someone be posing as a priest of the Order to deceive the people?

dialogue.name: OURCEN
dialogue.text: Who would do such a thing?

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: The plot thickens, Forename! Our culprit pretends to be a priest to lend credence to his deception. There is no doubt an irony in there somewhere.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: But I suspect we have a worthy adversary on our hands. I shall consider how best to handle this. For now, tell Isembard what we have learned here.

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: Posing as a priest!? To think...

dialogue.name: ISEMBARD
dialogue.text: These troubling notions aside, it is gratifying to finally be able to move this investigation forward. Thank you once again, Forename. I shall keep my ears and eyes open─now more than ever.
